verb
  1. (transitive) to do; used to vaguely refer to almost any action.
  2. (after an indirect quotation) to say (that)
  3. (transitive) to call, name
  4. (after an ideophone or onomatopoeia) to go; to act according to the ideophone; to make the sound of the onomatopoeia
  5. Used as a light verb to allow nouns and noun-like forms to function as active verbs. The verb itself has little to no real meaning. The noun functions as a direct object of the verb, being able to take particles such as the accusative case marker 을 or the topic marker 은.
  6. Used as a light verb to allow nouns and noun-like forms to function as adjectives. The verb itself has little to no real meaning. The noun can be separated by the topic marker 은.
  7. After certain roots, fully suffixed to form an inseparable verb or adjective.
  8. Used as a neutral verb after suffixes expressing intent or that something is about to happen.
  9. See 게 ᄒᆞ다 (-ge hawda, “to make; to cause to do; (forms the causative)”).
  10. See 게시리 ᄒᆞ다 (-gesiri hawda, “to make; to cause to do; (forms the causative)”).
  11. See 으렌 ᄒᆞ다 (-euren hawda, “to make; to cause to do; (forms the causative)”).
  12. See 어사 ᄒᆞ다 (-eosa hawda, “have to; must; should”).
  13. See 엇어사 ᄒᆞ다 (-eoseosa hawda, “should have; (shows regret)”).
  14. see ᄒᆞ고 (-hawgo, “and, with”).
  15. see ᄒᆞ곡 (-hawgok, “and, with”).
